paper.title: Automated Machine Learning with Monte-Carlo Tree Search
paper.abstract: The AutoML task consists of selecting the proper algorithm in a machine learning portfolio, and its hyperparameter values, in order to deliver the best performance on the dataset at hand. MOSAIC, a Monte-Carlo tree search (MCTS) based approach, is presented to handle the AutoML hybrid structural and parametric expensive black-box optimization problem. Extensive empirical studies are conducted to independently assess and compare: i) the optimization processes based on Bayesian optimization or MCTS; ii) its warm-start initialization; iii) the ensembling of the solutions gathered along the search. MOSAIC is assessed on the OpenML 100 benchmark and the Scikit-learn portfolio, with statistically significant gains over AUTO-SKLEARN, winner of former international AutoML challenges.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究自动化机器学习（AutoML）中的算法选择和超参数优化问题，虽然提到了‘portfolio’一词，但这里的‘portfolio’指的是机器学习算法的集合，而非金融投资组合。论文的核心技术并未涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融领域。
